taskGroup.name: Create Simple System
taskGroup.intro:
Welcome to BridgePoint.
In this tutorial, you will create a two components system using the steps of the xtUML methodology
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations you have completed all the tasks. You are now qualified to run heart Pacer cheat sheet.

task.name: Prepare the Workspace
task.intro: This cheat sheet teaches you how to prepare your workspace for xtUML modeling
task.onCompletion: You are now ready to begin creating the xtUML model.

task.name: Create xtUML Project
task.intro: This cheat sheet teaches you how to create an xtUML model
task.onCompletion: Your xtUML project is created and ready for Model Design.

taskGroup.name: Design
taskGroup.intro: In this phase, you will learn about model design
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations, you have finished the design phase.

task.name: Framework
task.intro: This step adds new packages and components to organize the project.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have succeeded in creating the initial structure of an application.

task.name: Architecture
task.intro: In this step, you will continue to build up the xtUML application.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations you are now ready to add implementation details.

taskGroup.name: Implementation
taskGroup.intro: In this step, the implementation for each component will be captured using classes.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations. Your implementation is finished and ready for testing.

task.name: State machine creation
task.intro: Next you'll create a simple state machine with two actions.

taskGroup.name: Verification
taskGroup.intro: In this step, OAL is added to the interface port to exercise the system.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Your stub is finished and ready to execute the model.

taskGroup.name: Execution
taskGroup.intro: In this step, the xtUML eXecute is used to run the system.

task.name: Execution in xtUML eXecute
task.intro: Running the model in xtUML eXecute.

taskGroup.name: Build and Code Generation
taskGroup.intro: In this step, the target implementation is created using code generation.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations. You have designed, implemented, verified, executed, built and generated your model.

task.name: Build and Code Generation
task.onCompletion: Congratulations! This completes the Simple System Model tutorial.
